pullRequest.body:
Add two more lemmas about inserting an element just before or after an interal in `â„•`:

```lean
lemma Icc_insert_succ_left (h : a â‰¤ b) : insert a (Icc (a + 1) b) = Icc a b := by

lemma Icc_insert_succ_right (h : a â‰¤ b + 1) : insert (b + 1) (Icc a b) = Icc a (b + 1) := by
```


---

- ...

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10019434380/job/27695992753)

Can you squeeze this `simp` by replacing it with the output of `simp?`? We want to avoid non-terminal `simp`'s because they are difficult to maintain.
I didn't think of `omega` as a rigid tactic (thus, I didn't consider this to be one of the places where a non-terminal `simp` is actually a problem), but I've made that change.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Order/Interval/Finset/Nat): `Icc_insert_succ_left`, `Icc_insert_succ_right`
